Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to paint and work with different colors to create 3D still lifes
Intro to color theory and acrylic painting.
I learned about color theory

I learned how to train my eye to recognize and examine the intricate details of still life and how light effects everything. I learned more about color theory composition and color mixing. I learned more about the technical aspects of how to translate what I see on to the canvas.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I found that the overall experience fell short of my expectations. While I was eager to learn various painting techniques and methods, the professor's approach to teaching left much to be desired.

One of the main concerns I had was the lack of emphasis on teaching fundamental painting techniques. Throughout the course, there was a notable absence of in-depth instruction on how to handle different brushes, blend colors effectively, or use various brush strokes to create different textures. This absence hindered my ability to fully grasp the technical aspects of painting, which I believe are essential for any aspiring artist.

Additionally, the professor seemed to primarily focus on color theory, leaving little room for other crucial aspects of painting. While understanding colors is undoubtedly important, it should not have been the sole focus of the entire course. I had hoped for a more well-rounded curriculum that would delve into composition, perspective, and other elements that contribute to creating compelling artwork.
I thought it was a great course! I loved the way it was taught and thought the profs did a great job of explaining and teaching by example. I definitely learned a lot!

Strengths: the intro to color theory beyond just the color wheel, the feedback given during the painting process, the relaxed and supportive atmosphere, the creative freedom, the end of project critiques. The final, collective still life was also really fun. I liked that it wasn't your typical still life set up. 
Weaknesses: I wish there was more feedback throughout the painting process and some basic technique instruction.
I would have loved for the program to be a full blown intensive program like the Yale Summer Acting Program with 4-5 classes on different aspects of painting.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Absolutely. I was my favorite class I ever took at Yale.
Yes!
Yes! Great intro to painting for painters of all levels. Kern is an amazing professor.
Yes I would recommend this course to another student. This course provides a great foundation and launchpad to building confidence, technique and creativity as a painter.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I can apply to skills Ive learned to painting as a hobby or for other activities in the future.
To continue to paint in my own time.
Definitely inspired me to try and paint more and to be more open/free with my painting.
This course has been an effective launchpad for me. Learning painting fundamentals allows me more freedom to explore and be creative now that I have a grasp on the basics.
